questions.question: What is the goal of a security assessment?
questions.answer: To identify vulnerabilities, weaknesses, and potential threats within an organization's systems, applications, or network infrastructure before they can be exploited.

questions.question: Why is continuous monitoring important?
questions.answer: The threat landscape is constantly changing. Continuous monitoring provides ongoing visibility into security posture, allowing for rapid detection and response to new threats or vulnerabilities.

questions.question: What is FISMA?
questions.answer: The Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) is a US law requiring federal agencies to develop, document, and implement agency-wide information security programs. Many contractors also need to comply.

questions.question: How can you help with audit remediation?

hero.title: Security Assessments & Code Reviews
hero.subtitle: Identifying vulnerabilities and strengthening your security posture through expert analysis.

overview.title: Uncovering Security Weaknesses
paragraphs: Proactive identification of security flaws is essential to prevent breaches. K2 Consulting offers comprehensive Security Assessments and secure Code Reviews designed to uncover vulnerabilities in your systems, applications, and infrastructure. Our assessments simulate real-world attack scenarios and evaluate your defenses against industry best practices and compliance requirements.

Our experienced security professionals utilize a combination of automated tools and manual testing techniques to perform thorough evaluations. We assess network configurations, application security, cloud environments, and adherence to security policies. Secure code reviews examine application source code for common programming errors that could lead to vulnerabilities like SQL injection, cross-site scripting (XSS), and buffer overflows. We provide detailed reports with prioritized findings and actionable recommendations for remediation.

features.title: Network Vulnerability Assessments
features.description: Scanning and analyzing network infrastructure for known vulnerabilities and misconfigurations.

features.title: Application Security Testing
features.description: Performing static (SAST) and dynamic (DAST) analysis to find flaws in web and mobile applications.

features.title: Cloud Security Assessments
features.description: Reviewing cloud configurations (AWS, Azure, GCP) for security best practices and compliance.

features.title: Secure Code Reviews
features.description: Manual and automated analysis of source code to identify security bugs and design flaws.

cards.title: Scoping & Planning
cards.description: Defining the objectives, scope, and methodology for the assessment or review.

cards.title: Information Gathering
cards.description: Collecting necessary details about the target systems, applications, or codebase.

cards.title: Vulnerability Analysis & Testing
cards.description: Executing scans, tests, and manual reviews based on the defined scope.

cards.title: Findings Validation & Prioritization
cards.description: Verifying identified vulnerabilities and prioritizing them based on risk and impact.

cards.title: Reporting & Recommendations
cards.description: Delivering a clear report detailing findings, potential impact, and actionable remediation steps.

cards.title: Remediation Support
cards.description: Providing guidance and support to development and operations teams during remediation.

questions.question: How often should we conduct security assessments?
questions.answer: Regular assessments (e.g., annually or semi-annually) are recommended, along with assessments after significant changes to systems or applications.

questions.question: What's the difference between a vulnerability assessment and penetration testing?
questions.answer: A vulnerability assessment identifies known weaknesses. Penetration testing goes further by attempting to actively exploit those weaknesses to simulate a real attack.

questions.question: Can secure code reviews slow down development?
questions.answer: When integrated properly into the development lifecycle (DevSecOps), code reviews can identify issues early, actually saving time and cost compared to fixing vulnerabilities found later in production.

questions.question: Do you provide remediation services?
questions.answer: While our primary focus here is assessment and review, we provide detailed recommendations and can work closely with your teams or partners to support the remediation process.

hero.title: Continuous Monitoring & Vulnerability Management
hero.subtitle: Proactively identifying threats and managing vulnerabilities to maintain a strong security posture.

overview.title: Maintaining Vigilance
paragraphs: The cyber threat landscape is dynamic, requiring constant vigilance. K2 Consulting provides Continuous Monitoring and Vulnerability Management services to help organizations stay ahead of threats. Our solutions offer ongoing visibility into your security posture, enabling rapid detection of suspicious activities and timely remediation of newly discovered vulnerabilities.

We implement robust monitoring systems (like Security Information and Event Management - SIEM) that collect and analyze log data from across your network, servers, and applications. Our vulnerability management program involves regular scanning, risk assessment of identified vulnerabilities, and tracking remediation efforts. By combining continuous monitoring with proactive vulnerability management, we help you reduce your attack surface and respond effectively to security events.

cards.description: Evaluating vulnerabilities and alerts based on severity, exploitability, and asset criticality.

questions.question: What is the difference between monitoring and vulnerability management?
questions.answer: Monitoring focuses on detecting active threats and suspicious behavior in real-time. Vulnerability management focuses on proactively identifying and fixing weaknesses before they can be exploited.

questions.question: How do you prioritize which vulnerabilities to fix first?
questions.answer: Prioritization is typically based on factors like the CVSS score (Common Vulnerability Scoring System), asset criticality, threat intelligence (is it being actively exploited?), and ease of exploitation.

questions.question: Do you offer 24/7 monitoring services?
questions.answer: We can tailor monitoring solutions to meet your needs, potentially partnering for 24/7 Security Operations Center (SOC) capabilities if required.

questions.question: How does patch management fit into vulnerability management?
questions.answer: Patching is a key remediation activity within vulnerability management. Applying vendor patches is often the primary way to fix identified software vulnerabilities.

hero.title: Audit Support & Compliance Reporting
hero.subtitle: Navigating security audits and meeting regulatory reporting requirements like FISMA.

overview.title: Meeting Compliance Mandates
paragraphs: Demonstrating compliance with security regulations and standards is essential for many organizations, particularly those working with government agencies. K2 Consulting provides expert Audit Support and Compliance Reporting services, helping you navigate complex requirements like FISMA (Federal Information Security Management Act), NIST standards, and others. We assist organizations in preparing for audits, responding to auditor requests, and addressing any identified findings.

Our team has extensive experience with federal compliance frameworks. We help develop Plans of Action & Milestones (POA&Ms) to track remediation efforts, compile necessary evidence of control implementation, and generate accurate compliance reports. Whether you need support for an upcoming audit, assistance with remediation activities, or ongoing FISMA reporting, our experts provide the guidance needed to achieve and maintain compliance efficiently.

questions.question: What is the difference between an internal and external audit?
questions.answer: Internal audits are conducted by an organization's own staff to assess controls, while external audits are performed by independent third parties, often for certification or regulatory purposes.

questions.question: Do we need FISMA compliance if we are a contractor?
questions.answer: Often, yes. Government contracts frequently require contractors handling federal information or operating federal systems to comply with FISMA requirements.

questions.question: What is a POA&M?
questions.answer: A Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) is a document used to track the progress of remediating identified security weaknesses or compliance gaps.

questions.question: How long does audit preparation typically take?
questions.answer: The duration varies significantly based on the scope of the audit, the organization's size, and its current security maturity. Starting preparation early is always recommended.

hero.title: Security Documentation & Support
hero.subtitle: Developing comprehensive security policies, procedures, and plans to support your security program.

overview.title: Building a Foundation for Security
paragraphs: Clear, comprehensive, and up-to-date documentation is the foundation of any effective security program. K2 Consulting provides expert Security Documentation services, helping organizations develop the policies, standards, procedures, and plans necessary to define security requirements, guide implementation, and demonstrate compliance. Well-crafted documentation ensures consistency, facilitates training, and provides crucial evidence during audits.

Our team assists in creating a wide range of security documents, including System Security Plans (SSPs), Incident Response Plans (IRPs), Contingency Plans (CPs), Security Policies, Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and more. We tailor documentation to your specific environment and compliance needs (e.g., NIST RMF, ISO 27001). Beyond initial creation, we offer ongoing support to review and update documentation as your systems and the threat landscape evolve, ensuring it remains accurate and relevant.

questions.question: Why is security documentation so important?
questions.answer: It defines expectations, guides actions, ensures consistency, provides training material, forms the basis for audits, and demonstrates due diligence.

questions.question: What is a System Security Plan (SSP)?
questions.answer: An SSP is a formal document that provides an overview of the security requirements for an information system and describes the security controls in place or planned for meeting those requirements.

questions.question: How do you ensure documentation stays up-to-date?
questions.answer: We recommend establishing a regular review cycle (e.g., annually) and processes to trigger updates whenever significant system changes, policy changes, or new threats emerge.

questions.question: Can you help train our staff on the policies and procedures?
questions.answer: Yes, developing documentation often goes hand-in-hand with security awareness training. We can assist in creating training materials based on the finalized documentation.
